name: Salted Duck Eggs
description: [Photographs: Robyn Lee] Domestically produced raw salted duck eggs are difficult to find, and imported ones are not available in the US. Cooked salted duck eggs, whole or yolk only, are widely available for purchase at Asian grocery stores and...

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the water and salt in medium saucepot and place over medium heat. Whisk over heat until salt is completely dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature.

Layer duck eggs in sealable glass or plastic container. Pour brine over duck eggs until completely covered. Cover container and store in cool place away from direct sunlight for at least three weeks until egg yolk is firm (see note). Cured eggs can be stored in refrigerator for up to two weeks.
